page.title: 06 HEANOR MARKET
page.content: Heanor market place is an open space in the centre of the town, overlooked by the Church with its clock and surrounded by shops and bus stops. From Mondays to Thursdays this area is used for car parking, a service which is not appreciated by pedestrians. On the Fridays and Saturdays the area is filled with stalls which include grocery, clothing, fancy goods and the most popular, the greengrocery. Prices are cheaper than the shops and the stall holder's profits are better on Fridays. Throughout the year the Market Place has other uses which include being the Fairground twice-a-year, housing the Victorian Market every May Day, the profits from this going to the Church Rebuilding Fund and the Town's Christmas tree is placed in the centre in December ready for the Carol singing services.
